SourcedStatement: There are no major projects on the freeways near SFO, so with a bit of luck, drivers headed to the airport shouldn’t face major delays, Caltrans officials said.
Name: Caltrans

SourcedStatement: More than 930,000 travelers will funnel through SFO from Thursday through Tuesday, according to SFO spokesperson Doug Yakel.
Name: Doug Yakel
Title: SFO spokesperson

SourcedStatement: That’s 8.7% more than last year’s Labor Day weekend.
Name: Doug Yakel
Title: SFO spokesperson

SourcedStatement: It’s also close to the number of travelers SFO saw in 2019, just months before the pandemic.
Name: Doug Yakel
Title: SFO spokesperson

SourcedStatement: To make it on time, holiday travelers should arrive at the airport two hours before domestic flights and three hours before international ones, Yakel said.
Name: Doug Yakel
Title: SFO spokesperson

SourcedStatement: Yakel said SFO has not been advised of staffing woes for Thursday, which was expected to be the busiest day of travel at the airport.
Name: Doug Yakel
Title: SFO spokesperson

SourcedStatement: I have TSA Pre, so that should make it a little easier,” said Bay Area resident Katelin Tharp, who on Thursday was booted from an overbooked flight to Boston, where she’s beginning her fifth year at Northeastern University.
Name: Katelin Tharp
Title: Bay Area resident

SourcedStatement: We’re sad since we just said goodbye to our one friend, and we don’t know if we’re ever going to see her again,” Ellie Mitchell, of the United Kingdom, told The Standard.
Name: Ellie Mitchell

SourcedStatement: Parking at airport garages will be in short supply this weekend, so travelers who want to leave cars at SFO should reserve spaces online as soon as possible, Yakel said.
Name: Doug Yakel
Title: SFO spokesperson

SourcedStatement: One of the busiest holiday weekends is here, and travelers at San Francisco International Airport may notice that the crowds are bigger than they’ve been in recent years.
Name: travelers
Justification: travelers at San Francisco International Airport

SourcedStatement: A United Airlines spokesperson said the three-hour warning was issued by mistake: somehow the company posted a years-old notice to the Chicago-bound boarding pass.
Title: spokesperson

SourcedStatement: The spokesperson shared a corrected advisory that suggested passengers “arrive early to avoid delays,” and to get a head start by checking bags from home and leaving luggage in the bag drop shortcut area at the airport.
Title: spokesperson
